title: Coronavirus vaccine trial participant signed up after losing friend
description: Mike, whose doctors asked us not to use his last name to protect his privacy, is taking part in a trial for INOVIO’s coronavirus vaccine. The Gates Foundation donated $5 million to support the research.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Experts warn of second coronavirus wave, concerns of reopening too soon
description: The nation’s top health experts warn a second wave of the coronavirus is very likely in fall and winter. If stay at home orders were lifted, 48 percent of Americans would not return to public places until the outbreak is over, a new CBS News poll finds.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Coronavirus may have hit big U.S. cities earlier than first thought
description: A New York study found 13.9 percent of 3,000 residents have COVID-19 antibodies, suggesting more people in the state may have been infected already. Northeastern University researchers say models suggest that there were already thousands of infections in the …
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: 26 million Americans file for unemployment in 5 weeks
description: Another 4.4 million workers filed for unemployment benefits last week because of the coronavirus pandemic, which makes for 26 million jobless claims filed over the last five weeks.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Empty Las Vegas casinos at center of clash over reopening
description: Casinos in Las Vegas have sat empty for weeks because of the coronavirus pandemic, representing millions in lost revenue. The mayor has pushed for the Strip to reopen, but the governor and casino operator Caesars Entertainment say that safety should come firs…
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Trump: ‘I disagree’ with Georgia governor’s move to reopen state
description: President Trump says he “strongly” disagrees with Georgia Governor Brian Kemp’s move to allow some businesses in the state to reopen tomorrow. The state has not met White House guidelines for a two-week decline in coronavirus cases before beginning to open up.
source.name: NBC News

author: Lauren Egan
title: House gives final passage to $484 billion coronavirus relief bill
description: The nearly $500 billion interim aid package includes additional money for the small-business loan program, as well as for hospitals and testing.
content: WASHINGTON The House passed a nearly $500 billion interim coronavirus bill on Thursday that includes additional money for the small-business loan program, as well as for hospitals and testing, making way for the legislation to become law by the end of the wee… [+5890 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: Erin Einhorn
title: Court: Detroit students have a right to read
description: The Sixth Circuit Court of Appeals ruled with Detroit students who say Michigan violated the constitution with deplorable schools.
content:
American children have a fundamental right to at least a basic education, a federal appeals court ruled Thursday.
In a ruling legal scholars said could affect disadvantaged children across the country, Sixth Circuit Court Judge Eric Clay wrote in an opinion … [+4959 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: Denise Chow
title: What we can (and can't) take away from New York's antibody testing results
description: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo on Thursday offered a shocking window into just how widespread the coronavirus outbreak has hit the state, but the data is easily misinterpreted.
content:
New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo on Thursday offered what appeared to be a surprising statistic on just how widespread the coronavirus outbreak has hit the state: Almost 14 percent of people tested in a new study were found to have COVID-19 antibodies.
It might be… [+8984 chars]
